content.text: is designed to verify the existence of accounts and meters within a utility billing system. It processes data related to accounts and meters, checks for discrepancies, and updates relevant tables to reflect the current state of account and meter exchanges. The procedure involves inserting, deleting, and updating records across multiple tables, and it handles specific business rules related to account and meter exchanges.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to several factors:
It involves multiple table operations, including inserts, deletes, and updates.
It uses temporary tables and joins across several tables.
It includes business logic that handles specific conditions and exceptions.
The procedure interacts with a significant number of columns and tables, indicating a complex data structure.
: This is an output parameter used to indicate the success or failure of the procedure. A value of
shows success, while a non-zero value shows failure.
: The procedure begins by declaring a variable
to track the number of rows processed.
, clearing them for fresh data insertion.
based on specific join conditions with
Handles specific business rules, such as removing accounts with exchange code 'AX' and utility company ID 7.
Deletes correctable fatal errors from this temporary table.
Inserts remaining records from the temporary table into
to mark records as processed based on the severity of errors.
to indicate successful execution unless errors are detected.
: Frequent truncation and deletion operations can be resource-intensive and lock tables, affecting performance.
: The procedure involves multiple joins, which can be optimized with appropriate indexing strategies to improve performance.
: The use of temporary tables can impact memory usage and should be monitored for performance implications.
: The procedure involves multiple delete operations, which could lead to data loss if not carefully managed.
: Truncating tables and performing bulk operations can lead to locking issues, affecting concurrent access to the database.
: The procedure assumes that certain errors are correctable, which may not always be the case, leading to potential data inconsistencies.
: As the volume of data grows, the performance of this procedure may degrade, necessitating further optimization or refactoring.

CREATE PROCEDURE [Nypa].[usp_PreProcessingVerifyAccountsAndMetersExistence] @Status INT  OUTPUT
   
 AS --**************************************************************************************
--* Name:         
--*
--* Description:  Verify accounts and meters existence
--*				  
--*               
--* Database:     OEC
--*
--* Return:	        0  Success
--*                 1 Failures
--*
--* AUTHOR:      Peter Heller
--* Created On:   04/10/2009
--**************************************************************************************
--* Date         Tech Description of Change
--* ---------- ----  -------------------------------------------------------------
--* 04/10/2009 PAH  First Version
--* 10/31/2013 PAH  Remove account "AX" where the current account number is being reused from one
--*					that was previously turned off
--* 2016-10-06	zd	integrated new exchange processing
--* 2018-12-13  VY  Modified for UniqueAccountSeqID
--***************************************************************************************
--
-- This proceedure will insert NYPA missing accounts and meters as a 46 exchange.
--
declare @UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerificationCount int
--
Truncate table Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence
Truncate table Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence
--
--DBCC CHECKIDENT ('Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence', RESEED,1)
--
--
INSERT INTO Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence
		(UtilityCompanyId, AccountBillingGroup, CurrentAccountBillingInvoiceContractBudgetLine, AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, CurrentAccountNumber, 
		OriginalAccountNumber, PreviousBillingPeriod, BillingPeriod, RevisedBillingPeriod, NextBillingPeriod, AgencyAccount, AccountSeqid, 
		UniqueAccountSeqID /*added on 12/13/2018 */, AccountStatus, 
		AccountPreviousStatus, AccountStatusCodePeriod, ExhangeCode, ExhangeFileSeqid, BillCreationDate, ExchangeEffectiveTransactionDate, 
		BillingAction, FromDate, ToDate, BillingAmount, CancelBillingAmount, NetBillingAmount, PenaltyBillingAmount, PenaltyPaidAmount, 
		CancelPenaltyBillingAmount, CancelPenaltyPaidAmount, AccountAmount, FuelAdjustment, CommodityChargeAmount, DeliveryChargeAmount, 
		DiscountAmount, DDDAmount, DDDRate, DeliveryEnergyAmount, DeliveryEnergyOffPeakAmount, DeliveryEnergyShoulderAmount, 
		DeliveryDemandAmount, DeliveryDemandOffPeakAmount, DeliveryDemandShoulderAmount, DeliveryFacilityPoints, CommodityConsumption, 
		CommodityConsumptionOffPeak, CommodityConsumptionShoulder, CommodityDemand, CommodityDemandOffPeak, CommodityDemandShoulder, 
		CommodityFacilityPoints, GRTAmount, GRTRate, EnergyCostAdjustment, EnergyCostAdjustmentPercentage, CancelAmount, 
		CancelFuelAdjustmentAmount, CancelCommodityChargeAmount, CancelDeliveryCharge, CancelDiscountedAmount, CancelDDDAmount, 
		CancelDDDRate, CancelDeliveryConsumption, CancelDeliveryConsumptionOffPeak, CancelDeliveryConsumptionShoulder, CancelDeliveryDemand, 
		CancelDeliveryDemandOffPeak, CancelDeliveryDemandShoulder, CancelDeliveryStreetLightingFacilityPoints, CancelCommodityConsumption, 
		CancelCommodityConsumptionOffPeak, CancelCommodityConsumptionShoulder, CancelCommodityDemand, CancelCommodityDemandOffPeak, 
		CancelCommodityDemandShoulder, CancelCommodityStreetLightingFacilityPoints, CancelGrossReceiptTax, CancelGRTAmount, CancelGRTRate, 
		CancelEnergyCostAdjustment, CancelEnergyCostAdjustmentPercentage, ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, BillingPeriodDays, InitialPostingDate, 
		AccountDemandUsage, AccountEnergyUsage, CancelAccountDemandUsage, CancelAccountEnergyUsage, IsSeasonalAccount, IsTimeOfDayAccount, 
		IsMinimumBilledCharged, MinimumBilledEnergyDollars, MinimumBilledDemandDollars, MaxBilledDemandPeriod, MaxBilledDemandUsage, 
		CancelIsMinimumBilledCharged, CancelMinimumBilledEnergyDollars, CancelMinimumBilledDemandDollars, CancelMaxBilledDemandPeriod, 
		CancelMaxBilledDemandUsage, IsSpannedPeriodBill, IsRowProcessed, DeliveryFacilityPointsAmount, CancelDeliveryFacilityPointsAmount, 
		AuthenticatedUserID, DateAdded, LastUpdate)
SELECT 
		UtilityCompanyId, AccountBillingGroup, CurrentAccountBillingInvoiceContractBudgetLine, AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, CurrentAccountNumber, 
		OriginalAccountNumber, PreviousBillingPeriod, BillingPeriod, RevisedBillingPeriod, NextBillingPeriod, AgencyAccount, AccountSeqid, 
		UniqueAccountSeqID /*added on 12/13/2018 */, AccountStatus, 
		AccountPreviousStatus, AccountStatusCodePeriod, ExhangeCode, ExhangeFileSeqid, BillCreationDate, ExchangeEffectiveTransactionDate, 
		BillingAction, FromDate, ToDate, BillingAmount, CancelBillingAmount, NetBillingAmount, PenaltyBillingAmount, PenaltyPaidAmount, 
		CancelPenaltyBillingAmount, CancelPenaltyPaidAmount, AccountAmount, FuelAdjustment, CommodityChargeAmount, DeliveryChargeAmount, 
		DiscountAmount, DDDAmount, DDDRate, DeliveryEnergyAmount, DeliveryEnergyOffPeakAmount, DeliveryEnergyShoulderAmount, 
		DeliveryDemandAmount, DeliveryDemandOffPeakAmount, DeliveryDemandShoulderAmount, DeliveryFacilityPoints, CommodityConsumption, 
		CommodityConsumptionOffPeak, CommodityConsumptionShoulder, CommodityDemand, CommodityDemandOffPeak, CommodityDemandShoulder, 
		CommodityFacilityPoints, GRTAmount, GRTRate, EnergyCostAdjustment, EnergyCostAdjustmentPercentage, CancelAmount, 
		CancelFuelAdjustmentAmount, CancelCommodityChargeAmount, CancelDeliveryCharge, CancelDiscountedAmount, CancelDDDAmount, 
		CancelDDDRate, CancelDeliveryConsumption, CancelDeliveryConsumptionOffPeak, CancelDeliveryConsumptionShoulder, CancelDeliveryDemand, 
		CancelDeliveryDemandOffPeak, CancelDeliveryDemandShoulder, CancelDeliveryStreetLightingFacilityPoints, CancelCommodityConsumption, 
		CancelCommodityConsumptionOffPeak, CancelCommodityConsumptionShoulder, CancelCommodityDemand, CancelCommodityDemandOffPeak, 
		CancelCommodityDemandShoulder, CancelCommodityStreetLightingFacilityPoints, CancelGrossReceiptTax, CancelGRTAmount, CancelGRTRate, 
		CancelEnergyCostAdjustment, CancelEnergyCostAdjustmentPercentage, ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, BillingPeriodDays, InitialPostingDate, 
		AccountDemandUsage, AccountEnergyUsage, CancelAccountDemandUsage, CancelAccountEnergyUsage, IsSeasonalAccount, IsTimeOfDayAccount, 
		IsMinimumBilledCharged, MinimumBilledEnergyDollars, MinimumBilledDemandDollars, MaxBilledDemandPeriod, MaxBilledDemandUsage, 
		CancelIsMinimumBilledCharged, CancelMinimumBilledEnergyDollars, CancelMinimumBilledDemandDollars, CancelMaxBilledDemandPeriod, 
		CancelMaxBilledDemandUsage, IsSpannedPeriodBill, IsRowProcessed, DeliveryFacilityPointsAmount, CancelDeliveryFacilityPointsAmount, 
		AuthenticatedUserID, DateAdded, LastUpdate
FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAAccountBilling

DELETE 
FROM	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence
FROM 	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence INNER JOIN
		Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack ON 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalAccountNumber
		
DELETE 
FROM	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence
FROM 	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence INNER JOIN
		Common.ExchangeData ON 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.CurrentAccountNumber and
		Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeCode <> '45'
		AND UtilityCompanySeqid = 7

DELETE 
FROM	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence
FROM 	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence INNER JOIN
		Common.ExchangeData ON 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.OriginalAccountNumber and
		Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeCode <> '45'
		AND UtilityCompanySeqid = 7

--SELECT DISTINCT 'Unknown Account',CurrentAccountNumber
--FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountExistence
--

INSERT INTO Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence
		(UtilityCompanySeqid, AccountBillingGroup, PreviousBillingPeriod, BillingPeriod, RevisedBillingPeriod, NextBillingPeriod, IsOriginalBilling, 
		CurrentAccountNumber, OriginalAccountNumber, CurrentMeter, OrginalMeter, AssociatedDemandMeter, NumberOfTransactions, 
		ConsumptionTransactions, DemandTransactions, AccountSeqid, UniqueAccountSeqID /*added on 12/13/2018 */, MeterSeqid, UniqueMeterSeqID /* added on 12/13/2018 */,  AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid, MeterBillingSeqid, 
		MeterBillingElectricSeqid, MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid, MeterStatus, MeterPreviousStatus, MeterStatusCodePeriod, ExhangeFileSeqid, 
		ExchangeCode, ExchangeEffectiveTransactionDate, MeterConstant, MeterTensionCode, MeterBillingAdjustmentTypeElectric, NumberOfDials, 
		BillCreationDate, SalesType, UtilityServiceAddress, RecordTypeConsumption, RecordTypeDemand, OrderedReadingCodePairs, 
		PreviousPeriodNumberOfEstimatedReadings, ConsumptionReadingCode, DemandReadingCode, MeterType, FromDate, ToDate, 
		ProductionServiceClass, ProductionServiceClassEffectiveDate, Consumption, ConsumptionFromReading, ConsumptionToReading, 
		ConsumptionHoursOffPeak, ConsumptionHoursShoulder, Demand, DemandToReading, DemandFromReading, DemandOffPeak, DemandShoulder, 
		StreetLightingFacilityPoints, CancelFromDate, CancelToDate, CancelConsumption, CancelConsumptionFromReading, CancelConsumptionToReading, 
		CancelConsumptionHoursOffPeak, CancelConsumptionHoursShoulder, CancelDemand, CancelDemandToReading, CancelDemandFromReading, 
		CancelDemandOffPeak, CancelDemandShoulder, CancelStreetLightingFacilityPoints, ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, ReadingTypes, CurrentBillingDays, 
		AdjustmentBillingDays, ConsumptionToReadingDate, ConsumptionFromReadingDate, DemandToReadingDate, DemandFromReadingDate, 
		PostingDate, IsUploadProcessed, ESTOrACT, IsTimeOfDayAccount, AccountName, AccountAddress, BilledDemand, CancelBilledDemand, 
		IsSpannedPeriodBill, MeterLocation, EstimatedReading, CurrentPeriodNumberOfEstimatedReadings, AuthenticatedUserID, LastUpdate, DateAdded)
SELECT 
		UtilityCompanySeqid, AccountBillingGroup, PreviousBillingPeriod, BillingPeriod, RevisedBillingPeriod, NextBillingPeriod, IsOriginalBilling, 
		CurrentAccountNumber, OriginalAccountNumber, CurrentMeter, OrginalMeter, AssociatedDemandMeter, NumberOfTransactions, 
		ConsumptionTransactions, DemandTransactions, AccountSeqid, UniqueAccountSeqID /*added on 12/13/2018 */, MeterSeqid, UniqueMeterSeqID /* added on 12/13/2018 */, AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid, MeterBillingSeqid, 
		MeterBillingElectricSeqid, MeterBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid, MeterStatus, MeterPreviousStatus, MeterStatusCodePeriod, ExhangeFileSeqid, 
		ExchangeCode, ExchangeEffectiveTransactionDate, MeterConstant, MeterTensionCode, MeterBillingAdjustmentTypeElectric, NumberOfDials, 
		BillCreationDate, SalesType, UtilityServiceAddress, RecordTypeConsumption, RecordTypeDemand, OrderedReadingCodePairs, 
		PreviousPeriodNumberOfEstimatedReadings, ConsumptionReadingCode, DemandReadingCode, MeterType, FromDate, ToDate, 
		ProductionServiceClass, ProductionServiceClassEffectiveDate, Consumption, ConsumptionFromReading, ConsumptionToReading, 
		ConsumptionHoursOffPeak, ConsumptionHoursShoulder, Demand, DemandToReading, DemandFromReading, DemandOffPeak, DemandShoulder, 
		StreetLightingFacilityPoints, CancelFromDate, CancelToDate, CancelConsumption, CancelConsumptionFromReading, CancelConsumptionToReading, 
		CancelConsumptionHoursOffPeak, CancelConsumptionHoursShoulder, CancelDemand, CancelDemandToReading, CancelDemandFromReading, 
		CancelDemandOffPeak, CancelDemandShoulder, CancelStreetLightingFacilityPoints, ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, ReadingTypes, CurrentBillingDays, 
		AdjustmentBillingDays, ConsumptionToReadingDate, ConsumptionFromReadingDate, DemandToReadingDate, DemandFromReadingDate, 
		PostingDate, IsUploadProcessed, ESTOrACT, IsTimeOfDayAccount, AccountName, AccountAddress, BilledDemand, CancelBilledDemand, 
		IsSpannedPeriodBill, MeterLocation, EstimatedReading, CurrentPeriodNumberOfEstimatedReadings, AuthenticatedUserID, LastUpdate, 
		DateAdded
FROM 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAMeterBilling

DELETE 
from	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence
from	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence INNER JOIN
		Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack ON 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentMeter = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.UtilityCompanySeqid	

DELETE 
from	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence
FROM	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence INNER JOIN
		Common.ExchangeData ON 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.CurrentAccountNumber AND 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentMeter = Common.ExchangeData.CurrentMeterNumber
		WHERE ExchangeData.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7
		
DELETE 
from	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence
from	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence INNER JOIN
		Common.ExchangeData ON 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentMeter = Common.ExchangeData.OriginalMeterNumber 
		WHERE ExchangeData.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7
--
--	The account exchange does not have meters associated with the transaction.  This query uses the following tables
--		Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack 
--		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence 
--		Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData 
--
--		Joining the following to determine the OriginalAccountNumber and OriginalMeterNumber currently existing in EC3 and
--		linking the CurrentAccountNumber billed to the new CurrentAccountNumber in the exchange data.
--
--			Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalAccountNumber = Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData.OriginalAccountNumber
--			Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalMeterNumber = Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentMeter INNER JOIN
--			Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData.CurrentAccountNumber AND 
--
DELETE 
from	Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence
FROM     
		Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack INNER JOIN
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence ON 
		Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalMeterNumber = Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentMeter INNER JOIN
		Common.ExchangeData ON 
		Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.CurrentAccountNumber AND 
		Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.OriginalAccountNumber
WHERE 
		(Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeCode = 'AX')   
		                                     	
--SELECT distinct 'Unknown Account-Meter Combination',CurrentAccountNumber, CurrentMeter
--FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileAccountMeterExistence
--
--	Check for any errors in the efile upload and cross check and update the Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData with the first byte of the SeverityError.
--
-- Create exchanges from the unknown Accounts ('UA') and known Account unknown Meter combinations ('UM') as the SENY '46' exchange transaction
--
--
--
--  Put code here for Create exchanges
--
--
--
Truncate table Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
--
SELECT 
		Description, SeverityError, BillingPeriod, ExchangeDataSeqid, ExchangeCode, CurrentAccountNumber, OriginalAccountNumber, 
		CurrentMeterNumber, OriginalMeterNumber, AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid
into 
		#ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
FROM 
		Nypa.uvw_ExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
--
--	Remove Fatal errors if they are correctable.  The correction below addresses a new account from an account exchange and
--	later or that same day has a meter exchange against the new account.
--
DELETE 
FROM	#ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
FROM 
		#ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification INNER JOIN
		Common.ExchangeData ON 
		#ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification.CurrentAccountNumber = Common.ExchangeData.CurrentAccountNumber AND 
		#ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification.ExchangeCode <> Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeCode
WHERE 
		(SUBSTRING(#ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification.SeverityError, 1, 1) = 'F')
		AND UtilityCompanySeqid=7

--***************************************************************************************
--* 10/31/2013 PAH  Remove account "AX" where the current account number is being reused from one
--*					that was previously turned off
--***************************************************************************************

DELETE  FROM #ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
FROM #ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification AS r
        INNER JOIN Billing.Account AS a ON a.CurrentAccountNumber = r.CurrentAccountNumber
                                           AND a.OriginalAccountNumber = r.CurrentAccountNumber
WHERE   ( r.ExchangeCode = 'AX' )
        AND ( a.AccountStatus = '28' )
--
INSERT INTO Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
          (Description, SeverityError, BillingPeriod, UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid, ExchangeCode, CurrentAccountNumber, OriginalAccountNumber, 
          CurrentMeterNumber, OriginalMeterNumber, AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid)
SELECT Description, SeverityError, BillingPeriod, ExchangeDataSeqid, ExchangeCode, CurrentAccountNumber, OriginalAccountNumber, 
                      CurrentMeterNumber, OriginalMeterNumber, AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid
FROM     #ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
--
SELECT @UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerificationCount = @@rowcount
--
SELECT @Status = 0
--
IF (@UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerificationCount <> 0)
  BEGIN
	UPDATE	Common.ExchangeData
	SET  
			IsProcessed = SUBSTRING(Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerification.SeverityError,1,1)
	FROM 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerification INNER JOIN
			Common.ExchangeData ON 
			Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerification.UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = Common.ExchangeData.ExchangeDataSeqid
			AND Nypa.UploadNYPAReconcileExchangeProcessTransactionVerification.BillingPeriod = Common.ExchangeData.BillingPeriod
			AND ExchangeDataSeqid =7
  END
--
DROP TABLE #ReviewExchangeProcessTransactionVerification
